Sequence Information.Peptide Name: PseA (Pseudomycoicidin; natural AMPs; bacteriocins; lantibiotics; Gram-positive bacteria, prokaryotes; UCSS1b;  XXT4; 1S=S)

Literature Information.Literature: 42.4% similar toAP01986.Chemical modification:  This antibiotic with four thioether rings and a disulfide bond. This bridges in this peptide have been further defined in a more recent paper: a disulfide bond between C3 and C7, four thioether bonds: T8-C13, T10-C16, S18-C21, S20-C26 (Janssen et al., 2022).Activity: zone inhibition: The recombinant form is active against B. subtilis (TMB016, TMB299, 416 TMB588), Streptococcus G 3643”10”, all tested S. aureus strains (S. aureus SG511, S. aureus 417 1000/93 and S. aureus 635/93), L. lactis NCTC497 and M. luteus. Not active against Gram- bacteria and C.albicans. Updated 11/2022 GW
Literature Information.Author: Basi-Chipalu S, Dischinger J, Josten M, Szekat C, Zweynert A, Sahl HG, Biebaum G.2015
Literature Information.Title: Pseudomycoicidin, a class II lantibiotic from Bacillus.
